abstracts.cdata!:
This restructuring paper seeks the
            approval of the Executive Directors to introduce the changes
            outlined in the Development Credit Agreement (DCA), and
            extension of the closing date from August 31, 2010 to
            December 31, 2011. This restructuring is a level one
            restructuring due to changes in the development objective
            and in all of the project's four components which are
            being refocused to meet the revised development objective.
            The major modifications being are as follows: 1) increase
            the importance of component one. Improving the investment
            climate while focusing it on the most needed reform areas in
            light of changes noted since the project's
            effectiveness and the increased government clarity and
            commitment to investment climate reform; 2) re-launch the
            matching grant subcomponent of component two. Facilitating
            private participation and enhancing competitiveness, so that
            it operates, as originally envisaged, and fully complements
            the investment promotion facilitation that has been
            supported under the project and contributes meaningfully to
            skills development in small and medium enterprises; 3) focus
            the activities financed under the project component three.
            Stimulating sector investment and implementing policy
            reforms - by terminating project's assistance to the
            following sub-components which have been completed or will
            not be completed in light of an absence of consensus: (a)
            telecommunication reform and development of information
            technology sector; (b) postal reforms; and (c) edible oil
            sector reform; 4) revise project development objective and
            restructure, simplify, and update the results framework to
            target and better measure the outcomes delivered by each
            component and subcomponent; 5) extend the closing date so as
            to enable sufficient time for implementation; and 6)
            reallocate funds across the project categories to accomplish
            the proposed changes.
